get.summary: Authenticates a user and obtains an authentication token
get.description: Get login token to use in subsequent api calls

parameters.name: service
parameters.description:
Optional query parameter, to specify a URL to redirect to on successful 
        authentication

parameters.name: namespace
parameters.description: namespaces available for the user.

get.summary: Gets the list of all configured namespaces
get.description: Gets the list of all configured namespaces.

parameters.name: limit
parameters.description: Number of objects requested in current fetch.

parameters.name: marker
parameters.description: Reference to last object returned.

parameters.name: name
parameters.description: Case sensitive prefix of the Namespace name with a wild card(*) Ex : any_prefix_string*

get.summary: Gets the details for the specified namespace
get.description: Gets the details for the given namespace.

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: Namespace identifier for which details needs to be retrieved.

put.summary: Updates namespace details like replication group list, namespace admins and user mappings
put.description:
Updates namespace details like replication group list, namespace admins and user mappings.

Replication group can be

  • Added to allowed or disallowed replication group list

  • Removed from allowed or disallowed replication group list

parameters.name: namespace
parameters.description: Namespace identifier whose details needs to be updated

200.description: Response indicating Success or Failure to update the namespace

post.summary: Creates a namespace with the given details
post.description: Creates a namespace with the given details.

200.description: Response indicating the result of the create operation

post.summary: Deactivates and deletes the given namespace and all associated user mappings
post.description: Deactivates and deletes the given namespace and all associated user mappings.

parameters.name: namespace
parameters.description: An active namespace identifier which needs to be deactivated/deleted

200.description: Response indicating Success or Failure to deactivate/delete namespace

get.summary: Gets the retention period for the given namespace and retention class
get.description: Gets the retention period for the given namespace and retention class.

parameters.name: namespace
parameters.description: Namespace for which retention period needs to retrieved

parameters.name: class
parameters.description: Class name for which retention period needs to retrieved

200.description: Retention period for the given namespace and retention class

put.summary: Updates the retention class details for a specified retention class for a namespace
put.description: Updates the retention class details for a specified retention class for a namespace.

parameters.name: namespace
parameters.description: Namespace identifier for which retention class needs to retrieved.

parameters.name: class
parameters.description: Retention class for which details needs to updated.

200.description: Response indicating Success or Failure to update retention class

get.summary: Gets the list of retention classes for the specified namespace
get.description: Gets the list of retention classes for the specified namespace.

parameters.name: namespace
parameters.description: Namespace identifier for which retention classes needs to retrieved

200.description: Retention class list for the given Namespace

post.summary: Creates a retention class for the specified namespace
post.description:
Creates a retention class for the specified namespace. The method payload specifies the retention class details
 which define a name for the class and a retention period.

parameters.name: namespace
parameters.description: Namespace identifier for which retention class needs to created.

200.description: Response indicating Success or Failure to create retention class

put.summary: Updates the namespace quota for a specified namespace
put.description: Updates the namespace quota for a specified namespace.

parameters.name: namespace
parameters.description: Namespace identifier for which namespace quota details need to be updated.

200.description: Response indicating Success or Failure to update namespace quota details

get.summary: Gets the namespace quota for a specified namespace
get.description: Gets the namespace quota for a specified namespace.

parameters.name: namespace
parameters.description: Namespace identifier for which namespace quota details needs to retrieved.

200.description: Response contains namespace quota details for the given namespace.

delete.summary: Deletes the namespace quota for the specified namespace
delete.description: Deletes the namespace quota for the specified namespace.

parameters.name: namespace
parameters.description: Namespace identifier for which namespace quota details needs to deleted.

200.description: Response indicating Success or Failure to delete namespace quota.
List of the replication groups in the system

post.summary: Creates a replication group that includes the specified storage pools (VDC:storage pool tuple)
post.description: Creates a replication group that includes the specified storage pools (VDC:storage pool tuple).

200.description: Response indicating Success or Failure to delete replication group

get.summary: Gets the details for the specified replication group
get.description: Gets the details for the specified replication group.

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: Replication group identifier for which details needs to be retrieved

200.description: Details of object virtual pools for the given identifier

put.summary: Updates the name and description for a replication group
put.description: Updates the name and description for a replication group.

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: Replication group identifier for which details needs to be updated

200.description: Response indicating Success or Failure to update replication group

put.summary: Adds one or more storage pools (as  VDC:storage pool tuples) to the specified replication group
put.description: Adds one or more storage pools (as  VDC:storage pool tuples) to the specified replication group.

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: Replication group identifier for which storage pool needs to be added

200.description: Response indicating Success or Failure to add virtual array to replication group

put.summary: Deletes a storage pool (VDC:storage pool tuple) from a specified replication group
put.description: Deletes a storage pool (VDC:storage pool tuple) from a specified replication group.

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: Replication group identifier for which storage pool needs to be removed

200.description: Response indicating Success or Failure to delete virtual array from replication group

post.summary: Creates a bucket in which users can create objects
post.description:
Creates a bucket in which users can create objects. The bucket is created in a storage pool associated with the specified replication group.

  • Current user will become the bucket owner.

  • If namespace to this bucket creation does not exist, user's namespace is used

  • For non SYSTEM_ADMIN user, namespace should be current user's namespace

200.description: Indicating success or failure of the bucket create operation

get.summary: Gets the list of buckets for the specified namespace
get.description:
Gets the list of buckets for the specified namespace. If namespace to this bucket creation does not exist
 then user's namespace is used.

parameters.name: namespace
parameters.description: Namespace for which buckets should be listed.

parameters.name: marker
parameters.description: reference to last object returned.

parameters.name: limit
parameters.description: number of objects requested in current fetch.

parameters.name: name
parameters.description: Case sensitive prefix of the Bucket name with a wild card(*) Ex : any_prefix_string*

200.description: List of buckets associated with the given namespace.

post.summary: List Groups for IAM User
post.description: List Groups for IAM User

parameters.name: UserName
parameters.description: Simple name identifying the user.

parameters.name: Marker
parameters.description: For pagination, the value of the Marker element in the response that you received to indicate where the next call should start.

parameters.name: MaxItems
parameters.description:
Use this only when paginating results to indicate the maximum number of items you want in the response.
 If additional items exist beyond the maximum you specify, the IsTruncated response element is true and
 Marker contains a value to include in the subsequent call that tells the service where to continue from.

parameters.name: x-emc-namespace
parameters.description: ECS namespace IAM entity belongs to, only required when request performed by management user

default_data_services_vpool.description: Default replication group identifier for this tenant when creating buckets

allowed_vpools_list.description: List of replication group that are allowed access to namespace

disallowed_vpools_list.description: List of replication group that are not allowed access to namespace

namespace_admins.description: Comma separated list of namespace admins

domain.description: A single-valued attribute indicating the user's IDP domain

key.description: Lookup string for this key-value pair

value.description: Lookup result for this key-value pair

user_mapping.description: List of user mappings for this tenant

external_group_admins.description: List of groups from AD Server

is_object_lock_with_ado_allowed.description:
Optional
Defines the default behavior for allowing Object Lock with ADO on new buckets created in the namespace. Existing buckets are not affected by this flag.
When true the is_object_lock_with_ado_allowed flag is applied to new buckets allowing them to enable Object Lock with ADO without having to explicitly enable the flag on the bucket.
When false or omitted, buckets created in the namespace will not be allowed to enable OBJECT LOCK with writable ADO unless the is_object_lock_with_ado_allowed flag is explicitly enabled on the bucket.
The flag only affects new buckets. Existing buckets must set the flag explicitly to allow Object Lock with ADO.
Warning: Once the flag is enabled on a bucket it cannot be changed. Make sure you understand the risk of data loss before enabling this flag. See the Admin Guide for more information.

period.description: Period of the retention class in seconds

retention_classes.description: List of retention classes for this tenant

name.description:
Name assigned to this resource in ECS. The resource name is set by
 a user and can be changed at any time. It is not a unique identifier.

id.description:
Identifier that is generated by ECS when the resource is created.
 The resource Id is guaranteed to be unique  and  immutable across all
 virtual data centers for all time.

href.description: Hyperlink URL to the related resource

link.description: Hyperlink to the details for this resource

creation_time.description: Timestamp that shows when this resource was created in ECS

inactive.description:
Indicates whether the resource is inactive. When a user removes
 a resource, the resource is put in this state before
 it is removed from the ECS database.

global.description: Indicates whether the resource is global.

remote.description: Indicates whether the resource is remote.

id.description: ECS Id of the related object

href.description: Hyperlink URL to the related resource

internal.description: Indicated whether the resource is an internal resource

NextMarker.description: Reference object to retrieve next set of objects.

Filter.description: filter used to get the objects.

NextPageLink.description: link to get the next page.

disallowed_vpools_list.description: List of replication group that are not allowed access to namespace

namespace_admins.description: Comma separated list of namespace admins

key.description: Lookup string for this key-value pair

value.description: Lookup result for this key-value pair

user_mapping.description: List of user mappings for this tenant

external_group_admins.description: List of groups from AD Server

is_object_lock_with_ado_allowed.description:
Optional
Defines the default behavior for allowing Object Lock with ADO on new buckets created in the namespace. Existing buckets are not affected by this flag.
When true the is_object_lock_with_ado_allowed flag is applied to new buckets allowing them to enable Object Lock with ADO without having to explicitly enable the flag on the bucket.
When false or omitted, buckets created in the namespace will not be allowed to enable OBJECT LOCK with writable ADO unless the is_object_lock_with_ado_allowed flag is explicitly enabled on the bucket.
The flag only affects new buckets. Existing buckets must set the flag explicitly to allow Object Lock with ADO.
Warning: Once the flag is enabled on a bucket it cannot be changed. Make sure you understand the risk of data loss before enabling this flag. See the Admin Guide for more information.

vpools_added_to_allowed_vpools_list.description: List of replication group identifier which will be added in the allowed List for allowing namespace access

vpools_added_to_disallowed_vpools_list.description: List of replication group identifier which will be added in the disAllowed list for prohibiting namespace access

vpools_removed_from_allowed_vpools_list.description: List of replication group identifier which will be removed from allowed list

vpools_removed_from_disallowed_vpools_li.description: List of replication group identifier which will be removed from disAllowed list for removing their prohibition namespace access

is_encryption_enabled.description:
Does request contain update of encryption enabled of namespace.
 If null then encryption update is not requested else it is.

is_object_lock_with_ado_allowed.description:
Optional
Defines the default behavior for allowing Object Lock with ADO on new buckets created in the namespace. Existing buckets are not affected by this flag.
When true the is_object_lock_with_ado_allowed flag is applied to new buckets allowing them to enable Object Lock with ADO without having to explicitly enable the flag on the bucket.
When false or omitted, buckets created in the namespace will not be allowed to enable OBJECT LOCK with writable ADO unless the is_object_lock_with_ado_allowed flag is explicitly enabled on the bucket.
The flag only affects new buckets. Existing buckets must set the flag explicitly to allow Object Lock with ADO.
Warning: Once the flag is enabled on a bucket it cannot be changed. Make sure you understand the risk of data loss before enabling this flag. See the Admin Guide for more information.

can not include dots or slashes (.|/) in the name

name.description:
Name assigned to this resource in ECS. The resource name is set by
 a user and can be changed at any time. It is not a unique identifier.

enable_rebalancing.description: Parameter to check if the rebalancing is enabled

isAllowAllNamespaces.description: Parameter to check if the Vpool can access all Namespace

isFullRep.description: Parameter to check for full replication

id.description:
Identifier that is generated by ECS when the resource is created.
 The resource Id is guaranteed to be unique  and  immutable across all
 virtual data centers for all time.

href.description: Hyperlink URL to the related resource

link.description: Hyperlink to the details for this resource

creation_time.description: Timestamp that shows when this resource was created in ECS

inactive.description:
Indicates whether the resource is inactive. When a user removes
 a resource, the resource is put in this state before
 it is removed from the ECS database.

global.description: Indicates whether the resource is global.

remote.description: Indicates whether the resource is remote.

href.description: Hyperlink URL to the related resource

internal.description: Indicated whether the resource is an internal resource

name.description: New name fro the replication group

description.description: New description for the replication group

enable_rebalancing.description: set if geo rebalancing is enabled

name.description: Unique name identifying this classification of replication group

zone_mappings.description: List of varrayId-zoneId tuples with are associated with the same vpool created under data-services

enable_rebalancing.description: set if geo rebalancing is enabled

isAllowAllNamespaces.description: set if Vpool Allows access to all Namespaces for dataservices

remote.description: Indicates whether the resource is remote.

id.description: ECS Id of the related object

href.description: Hyperlink URL to the related resource

internal.description: Indicated whether the resource is an internal resource

blockSize.description:
Block size in GB. Cannot be less than 1GB or use decimal values.
 Can be set to -1 to indicate quota value not defined.

notificationSize.description:
Notification size in GB. Cannot be less than 1GB or use decimal values.
 Can be set to -1 to indicate quota value not defined.

filesystem_enabled.description: flag indicating whether file-system is enabled for this bucket

head_type.description:
HeadType indicates the object head type that is allowed to access the bucket. If the bucket has FS-Enabled,
 then the FS heads are implicitly allowed to access this bucket

namespace.description: Namespace associated with the user/tenant that is allowed to access the bucket

Tag.description: Tags - list of tags set for the Bucket

is_encryption_enabled.description: tag to enable encryption for the bucket

default_group_file_read_permission.description: Flag indicating the Read permission for default group

default_group_file_write_permission.description: Flag indicating the file write permission for default group

default_group_file_execute_permission.description: Flag indicating the file execute permission for default group

default_group_dir_read_permission.description:
Flag indicating the directory read permission for default group. This is only applicable to folders created
 within the Filesystem-Enabled bucket. It is not applicable to files/objects

default_group_dir_write_permission.description:
Flag indicating the directory write permission for default group. This is only applicable to folders created
 within the Filesystem-Enabled bucket. It is not applicable to files/objects

default_group_dir_execute_permission.description:
Flag indicating the directory execute permission for default group. This is only applicable to folders created
 within the Filesystem-Enabled bucket. It is not applicable to files/objects

is_stale_allowed.description: tag to allow stale data in bucket

is_object_lock_with_ado_allowed.description: permanently sets flag on the bucket to allow Object Lock and ADO to be enabled together.

is_tso_read_only.description: enable the Access During Outage option, which allows read access

metadata.description: Searchable tags assigned to objects created within the bucket.

metadata_tokens.description: metadata search: whether to treat metadata value as array of values (true) or single value (false)

audited_delete_expiration.description: Audit delete expiration time in seconds

is_object_lock_enabled.description: Enables object lock for existing bucket.

local_object_metadata_reads.description: Local object metadata reads bucket flag.

error_message.description: Message returned by the server indicating the reason for create bucket failure (if any)

is_empty_bucket_in_progress.description:
Optional.  If true the bucket is in the process of being deleted.  The bucket will be read only and no changes will be allowed on the bucket
  until the operation completes.

local_object_metadata_reads.description: Local object metadata reads bucket flag.
